number of helpful: 14 of 18 people (78%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: January 24, 2016
												I have over 600 games in my Steam account, and the vast majority of them are still unplayed. So now I'm dedicating an hour to each of these games and writing a series of One Hour Reviews. An hour isn't very long to judge a game on, so think of this as more of a first impression, and take this review in the spirit in which it's given. Be sure to read other reviews from players who have spent more time in the game. One Hour Reviews #49 - DogFighterExactly as you'd expect from the title, DogFighter pits you as a fighter pilot against a number of other pilots.  It's pretty much deathmatch with propellar planes, which isn't itself a bad thing.I started with the tutorial, which does a perfectly good job taking you through the various controls in the game.   The left stick controls the plane, while the right stick is used for performing different maneuvers, which include barrel rolls in either direction, a loop, and an Immelmann turn.Much like a typical deathmatch game, you pick up powerups, which can provide both offensive and defensive capabilities.  Offensive items are activated with the right trigger, and defensive items are activated with the left trigger.The flight model is completely arcade-like, so anyone expecting simulator level realism should look elsewhere.  But, on the flip side, the game is very easy to pick up.The game offers some different game modes, but they don't really change the core gameplay which is to fly your plane, shoot other plans, and don't get shot down.  All of the game modes are just variations of the basic deathmatch.Which brings me to the problem I had with this game.  You can't really have a deathmatch game without other people playing it.  And nobody seems to be playing this anymore.  Granted, this game came out back in 2010, but sadly it seems the shelf life of this game was pretty short, and people have moved on.  So, unless you fancy playing deathmatch with a bunch of bots, you are better off looking at other games.

number of helpful: 10 of 11 people (91%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 10, 2016
Teal DeerDevelopers: Dark Water Studios Publishers: Instinct SoftwareInitial release: Jun 2010Genre: Action, Flying, Dogfight, Casual, Arcade#Worth/NotWorth: #WaitforSaleBSERC - (Borderline Sardonic and Extremely Reductive Comparison): The DogFight only version of Crimson Skies. Exposition, Concurrence and SummationDogFighter is a silly game in all honestly. But it's a earnest sort of silly. The game feels very late 90's early 2000's; it features a rather campy sort of rock soundtrack that feels like you are entering the ring at a WWF/WCW/NWO event. It has multiplayer but still features bot matches. For the price, there is a surprising amount of level/map variety as well as weapon variety. A decent amount of pick-ups in game to alter things like boost or top speed. Front and rear firing weapons across different handling planes accompany a variety of modes, not a TON of modes as they are all variations of a standard Dogfight but team matches, lone wolf matches and tournaments are more than I was expecting.  THE GISTIt's way more than I expected for the price, it actually is a bit a fun for a small bit of time but has no real legs and is a nice filler/palette cleanser game. Especially if you just want to fly around and shoot at crap. Follow my curation for more

number of helpful: 7 of 9 people (78%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 19, 2016
												I am reluctant to trash a game with so little gameplay minutes but this game puts forward all it has to offer very quickly. Unfortunately it is not quite as good as one could have hoped after seeing the trailer.  The trailer video shows ultra-tight multiplay fun and really fast flying! ...but in reality the speed is not there. Boost does not add much. There are also zero people online. And the controls: Play it with a gamepad and aiming is hell. Play it with a flightstick and the twitchy gameplay will be hell for you and your stick.  Play it with a mouse and you will get trashed in the close quarters turns. I simply was not able to find a proper control scheme that worked. Mouse was the best though. A flying arcade game can be fast and playable on multiple control types. e.g. Skydrift. It is not an entirely lost case though. Game is probably at it's best when played with a few friends who are all of the same skill level. This could probably be quite nice LAN game among friends. But playing against the few random humans online or bots? Forget it. Not worth it even at this price. 4/10

content:
Posted: March 5, 2016
												There are some ideas that are so simple that passionate developers ruin them by making things more difficult than they have to be.  My major complaint with this game is the controls.  There are too many for a casual game like this.  Also, this game takes a lot of tweaking to respond semi-smoothly -- mouse sensitivity (never did figure out the game pad).  All in all, the maps seem pretty standard.  The planes aren't based on Flight Simulator mechanics, but I wasn't expecting that.  I kind of just wanted to start this game up and have fun.  I didn't want to fiddle with it forever.  This games needs simplification and also should be optimized for slower PC's.  I don't recommend buying this.

												An incredibly fun little game.  Very restricted number of maps, and the single-player AI is.. well.. a little on the dumb side. content:
Posted: July 3, 2016
												Has no singleplayer campaign or anything like it. Multiplayer has been dead for half a decade. Basically all you can do is run deathmatch, wave survival, or time limit killing against bots. All of it basically boils down to the same thing, as you use the same 5 pickups, and every level is the exact same because it doesn't matter what's in the background since you're up in the sky. Gets boring and repetitive fast. Impossible to manuever quickly or make fast/tight turns with the mouse controls, which is what this type of game is all about. Interest in this lasts about as long as the Wright brothers first flight, 1 minute. 3/10

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 25, 2010
												This is a great game! The flying in the game is alot of fun! The "dogfighting" is intense when you are trying to kill other people. The challenges in the game are awesome. The graphics make you feel like you are really in that area. The controls are not hard to get used to. The guns are fun to shoot. The planes are great looking and have their own flight style. There is CTF, DM, and TDM match play, there is also a lone wolf match were your against a tone of bots which is alot of fun to do with a friends. The sounds in the game make it intense to hear gun fire come your way. The online community is great and very competative. The guys at Dark Water constantly try to improve the game play and make things better all the time. If you enjoy playing a good time flight fighting arcade style game then this is the game for you. If you get it you won't regret it! So get it already!!

												Was hoping this to be related in some way to the fantastic but old dogfigher game where you fly in the house and fight with toys.The game lacks polish. The UI  (menus, dialogs, controls) are aweful. There is no way to control or change the settings while in the tutorial. If I need to invert the axes or change mouse sensitivity I have to quit and restart the tutorial. Enabling realistic flight mode made the plane move like a snake. absolutely out of control. May be the controls are better with xbox controller, but the lack of polish everywhere makes me doubt that. For 2.99 it is probably a very good game for a young kid. But for any serious players its waste of money and slot on steam.

content:
Posted: October 9, 2016
Product received for free
												Want a summary of how bad this game is? The only thing you really need to know is this game uses the Pause/break and scroll lock button in the control scheme... wtf. While that's the number 1 thing the annoys me, the soundtrack, consisting of only a couple incerdibly generic rock music, drove me insane. I only got to play the tutorial, which was very long and boring by the way, and when I tried to join a singleplayer game (because this game's player base might consist of two people) the game crashed and I didn't see a point in launching it again.TL:DR This is just another crappy indie plane fighting games that has no one fight against.Addendum: This game also takes all the skill out of the genre by binding all the basic plane moves (ie. barrel roll and loop the loop) to hot keys. Whether or not you see that has good or bad is really up to you.

number of helpful: 2 of 7 people (29%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 27, 2014
												Neat little game that I could accustom it to Quake or that style of arena FPS but with planes and the constraints of them. Its interesting and somewhat fun, but on Team Death Match when playing in singleplayer the friendly AI are useless unfortunately. Though Deathmatch is still fun but even on hard the AI dont really stand much of a chance against a real human. Since this game is so old though and it was a mainly multiplayer focused game the multiplayer is expectantly dead at this point. No one is online aside from a few crazed and forgotten souls in limbo.Since it is a multiplayer focused game and dead, and the singleplayer component isn't that challenging or fun I would advise not buying this game unless you have a group already interested in playing the game as you will need other people to play with to get the most out of the game. Though it is some fun to just fly around blasting bots its not that fun for a very long time.

												The controls seemed better in 2010 as did the graphics. This game has a dated feel. I think the development team mentioned trying to bring it back, but it may need somewhat of an overhaul to feel like a competitive fighter jet game by today's standards.

content:
Posted: May 4, 2012
												Graphically intense, sound is brilliant, the music Awesome - and then it starts to go flat...Controls require you to have 3 or 4 hands, Joystick support is really a joke - My Thrustmaster Fox 2 Pro cannot be remapped, but if you have an XBox 360 controller you are laughing. Single play is really nothing more than training that can jerk you around randomly, and online play is pretty rare - out of the 4 times I tried it, 3 times I gave up after 20 mins because I had no enemies, the 1 time I found someone, the lag was intense and the other player was so good, it was a turkey shoot.4/10 Dragons

And I look to Him, bend over, and say "Again, please."That good.  Seriously.

												Ok, so this game isn't superfantastic in any way, but it's fun to play and pretty easy to get into.It's hard to give this game a score, it's a pretty small game, and it's super cheap, so it's worth you money.I would also say that the frustration level while playing is failry low, so it's a great game if you just want to relax and not have to think too much.6/10 it's fun, worth your money, it won't suck you in or captivate you for very long, but it's a great game to play if you need a break from other games.
